newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swissair shares face selling pressure.
newsitem.headline: Swissair shares face selling pressure.

text.p: Swissair-Schweizerische Luftverkehr AG shares fell below 1,000 Swiss francs and stayed under pressure on worries about higher fuel prices, fare wars and its partner Delta's link-up with Air France, dealers said.
At 0940 GMT, Swissair registered shares were off 27 francs, or 2.65 percent, at 990 in a slightly easier overall market.
"I think the shares are more likely to head toward 900 francs than return quickly above 1,000," one dealer said.
A Swissair spokesman said it had made no new decisions on changing fares and reiterated that Delta 's cooperation with Air France would not hurt business.
